title: How to Mark Quilt Lines Using Tulle or Netting

steps.headline: Select the quilt pattern that you'll be using.
steps.description: Place it down on a flat surface.

steps.headline: Place a piece of tulle or netting fabric larger than the pattern over the quilt pattern.
steps.description: If the pattern is large and/or there is a chance of the tulle slipping, tape or pin it in place.

steps.headline: Trace the pattern onto the tulle.
steps.description: Use a dark colored marker so that it easy to see what you're creating and where you've already drawn.

steps.headline: Take special care with delicate features of the pattern.
steps.description: You might need to switch to a finer pen.

parts.name: Using the tracing to transfer the pattern

steps.headline: Remove the traced tulle from the pattern.
steps.description: Set aside to dry completely; otherwise, there is a risk of transferring the marker ink to the fabric.

steps.headline: When dry, position the marked tulle directly onto the quilt fabric where the pattern needs to be.
steps.description: Trace back over the exact same lines using a fabric marking pencil. Check frequently to see that the marks are transferring onto the fabric.

steps.headline: Continue to mark all the lines you've copied.
steps.description: You're done when all of the pattern or design has been transferred.

text: Placement of the tulle Select the quilt pattern that you'll be using. Place it down on a flat surface. Place a piece of tulle or netting fabric larger than the pattern over the quilt pattern. If the pattern is large and/or there is a chance of the tulle slipping, tape or pin it in place. Tracing the pattern Trace the pattern onto the tulle. Use a dark colored marker so that it easy to see what you're creating and where you've already drawn. Take special care with delicate features of the pattern. You might need to switch to a finer pen. Using the tracing to transfer the pattern Remove the traced tulle from the pattern. Set aside to dry completely; otherwise, there is a risk of transferring the marker ink to the fabric. When dry, position the marked tulle directly onto the quilt fabric where the pattern needs to be. Trace back over the exact same lines using a fabric marking pencil. Check frequently to see that the marks are transferring onto the fabric. Continue to mark all the lines you've copied. You're done when all of the pattern or design has been transferred. Continue with making your quilt.
